creator: bernd.kuehl@verdisoft.com
text:
Hello,

I have two Java JDKs installed on my machine (1.3 and 1.4). JAVA_HOME points 
to JDK1.3. While installing tomcat I selected that tomcat should use the 
JDK1.4, but when I start tomcat it nevertheless uses JDK 1.3... 

Thx,

Bernd

i have the same problem .
if possible uninstall jdk1.4 and install it once again doing so what i think is 
it will write it's own property on default resource files on the systems used 
by jvm.
creator: myaneel@hotmail.com
bernd.kuehl@verdisoft.com
text:
Thx for your feedback, but I will not uninstall and re-install JDK1.4. I will 
wait for a Tomcat 5 patch to correctly use the JDK selected in the 
installation process.

Thx,

Bernd
I believe the .exe will also use JAVA_HOME now.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
When the exe uses JAVA_HOME and not the JDK selected during the installation, 
then you have to change the installation process to no longer ask for theJDK.

It makes no sense to ask which JDK to use and then use another JDK.

Thx,

Bernd
creator: bernd.kuehl@verdisoft.com
remm@apache.org
text:
Indeed, this is a good point, but I believe the new .exe also does this
correctly (the path to the JDK is passed to it). Did you try 5.0.24 or are you
complaining about 5.0.19 ?
When filing bugs, always test the latest build, we don't care about bugs that
have been fixed already.

creator: bernd.kuehl@verdisoft.com
text:
Hello,

Yes I'm complaining about 5.0.19 (see Version field of this bug).

When I select to download the current tomcat release I get tomcat 5.0.19 and 
not tomcat 5.0.24. 

Moreover you as organization should know what has changed between the release 
version (5.0.19) and a current development version (5.0.24). Why do I have to 
tell you whether this has changed by installing the non release version and by 
testing this for you?

I reopen the bug. Please fix the bug or please mark this bug as duplicate of 
an already fixed bug.

Thx and sorry,

Bernd

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Please read the bug submission guidelines
(http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/bugreport.html) and don't reopen the report.
It is not my problem if you cannot upgrade or test a newer build: BZ is a tool
for developers, not a tribune where users seek help.

creator: bernd.kuehl@verdisoft.com
text:
Yes I read that page and followed all steps on the page before writing the 
bug. No old bug exists, the FAQ says nothing, ...

Yes BZ is a tool for developers. Therefore I use BZ to report the developers 
that tomcat 5.0.19 has a bug.

I do not seek help. I'm able to set JAVA_HOME temporary to a different value.

I will not reopen the bug, but:

You know know that 5.0.19 has a bug.

It seems that you do not care whether the bug still exists in 5.0.24....

Bernd
